lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Darin.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Excited to have you back. We've all recovered from a crazy Comic-Con, mostly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have we recovered?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm being optimistic here. We're recovering from a Comic-Con. Got a chance to meet a bunch of you guys out there. It was a lot of fun, but we're here to get our announcements started, so let me do that. First off, Laura, I believe there's a merch update.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cord. And we've got them a keychain. And now, I don't know if you saw them before, but they took a long time to get, and now we just have them in the store.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they going to run out again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. It depends on how many people buy them, I guess, but we're going to try to keep them in stock. That's the statement that like, okay, that happened, but this is what I'm really excited about.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell them!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've got the "How do you want to do this?" pencil. We've got the "I would like to rage" pencil. We've got a Scanlan pencil-- oh no, this is a Tary pencil. This is a "Doty, take this down" pencil. I don't want to say all the things because they're so great, but check them out. It's in the store now. Does everybody want their pencil?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are these #2 pencils? Could someone take the SAT with my "Doty, take this down" pencil?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a #2 pencil!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa, that's so amazing!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy, what's yours?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't want to say.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want the Trinket pencil, Darin?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Such a good one. Oh, this is the Pike one. And here's yours, Matt. It's pretty dope, so check them out. I'm in love.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's great is if you use it a lot, eventually "How do you want to do this?" becomes "do you want to do this?" to "you want to do this?" to "want to do this?" to "do this?" to "this?" (laughs) It's existential the entire time you're using the pencil. I'm really excited about that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I hadn't even thought about that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so excited now to see what it spells out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It just keeps on giving. Thank you, Laura.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're welcome. I'm excited.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Next up, for Gen Con, we have our live show. We only have about 400 tickets left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that true?

lines.name: TALIESIN, MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For us? We're just a bunch of nerdy-ass voice actors.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We already surpassed the number of seats we had last year, because we have an extra thousand seats in this larger theater. It's going to be a madhouse. We only have 400 left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And there may or may not be-- I don't know if I should announce this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One of us is going to die that night, and I don't mean a character.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We may or may not have special merchandise that you can only get at the live show.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa. But surely it will be in the store afterwards?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nope, it's just a live show thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just exclusive to the live show?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, see, you'd have to be there to find out, so if there is a car, a plane, or a train, or a telephone booth around you, get to Indianapolis on August 18th!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: August 18th! How was that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. It was terrible. It was really bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll be excited if anyone got my Wonder Showzen reference.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not even anyone at the table.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you should not. It's disturbing as shit. Just stacking you up today, boy!

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: (child-like voice) This is the best place ever! Thank you so much for this! It makes me very happy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Come in and join me down here for a second and talk into the camera. Hey, buddy!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Too low? Is this all right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think we're all right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They might just see your forehead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just the forehead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There it is! I know, this is great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what's the update?

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: It has led to an unexpected complication, though, in that our initial print run is of a size that cannot be changed right now. We had to stop taking pre-orders so we would have some to send to stores, because obviously, we value game stores and we want them to have some, so I just wanted to reassure everybody that this book is not a limited edition book. We're printing more, so if you were not able to pre-order it, you will be able to get it later. We're basically going to immediate reprint. In the interim, the PDF is still available, so you can get that if you like electronic books, or if you have a local store, they can take part in what's called our Pre-Order Plus program. It allows people to pre-order through the store and then get the $5 PDF deal that we were offering as part of the pre-order. So ask your local stores, do you take part in Pre-Order Plus? If you need a link for that, you can check our Twitter. Otherwise, second print run will be along as soon as we can get it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fantastic. Thank you so much, Chris! Appreciate it, buddy. Enjoy the show!

lines.name: CHRIS
lines.text: Oh, and we'll have copies at Gen Con.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, we'll have copies at Gen Con!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Even more reason!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Boy, is that book fucking beautiful!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm so nervous about its release.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have some notes on the cover.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have some notes on the book. Could it have less words?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it just has less gnome bard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The whole race died off in a Calamity. They don't know what happened. Pike was the only one who was spared.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's so weird. (laughs) Don't worry, we have a fix on the way. It'll be fine. Next up: Critical Role podcast on iTunes and such.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: More is coming very soon. Very, very soon. Next batch is coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking forward to that. The Sagas of Sundry: Dread show that me and Taliesin are part of. Fifth episode is up is today on Alpha.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's almost over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know. We have one more episode of this, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And check out these awesome Dread shirts, you guys! They're in the store. Aren't they awesome?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you haven't seen it yet, it's a fantastic pseudo-theater improv RPG horror show with me and Taliesin as part of the cast. Marisha's one of the executive producers, and Darin De Paul is our fantastic Rod Serling intro personality. So check it out if you haven't yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mr. Wren!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mr. Wren. It's a fun one. I think that's it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, there's a couple more things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not on the list!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you got a little boxy back there that you should pull out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, right! Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does it have a small creature in it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it have air holes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This question has come up a lot. The combat tiers, the plastic platforms that I use for height in the game, have been out of stock, out of production for a while now. They're finally available again. Our friends at Emerald Knights got us these boxes. These are available off Paizo.com. You can go ahead and pick up the combat tiers. They are now available again if you've been wondering where the heck to get some.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And they're out of stock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think Jay at Emerald Knights told me that they're going to be in stores soonish as well, but you can go to Paizo right now-- tweet! And go find them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These have saved my ass many times in games, as you've seen. Highly recommended for anyone who's DMing or running a game. It's awesome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Been in our game since day one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I remember when I got those for you when they were still prototypes in a little white box.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they were in a little standard cardboard box. You were like, this looks like it should work. Saved my ass.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And Laura and I are in this really cool game called Lone Echo by Ready at Dawn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's the guys that did The Order.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We both play AI.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're computers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. Very calm the whole time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right. We'll help you out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (snoring)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which is cool. It's VR. It's really badass, so check it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's great. Well cool, thank you guys for the update. What you got, Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I got nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well then, without further ado--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, my little Trinket dice bag isn't here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody cares but you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's still in the thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So to announce that her bag isn't here, we're going to take a moment--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry. I'll go and get it during the credits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth, by entwining your hands with the rest of the party and focusing on this strange magical essence hidden within Sprigg's form, you completed your Plane Shift spell. You found yourself suddenly within a dimension of an endless library, shelves of winding books and tomes that spiral beyond sight. In the midst of this amazing atmosphere, a voice called you to a central portion of the chamber. There, it seems, you've come across the Knowing Mistress, Ioun herself, there awaiting your arrival.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did we see her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Is she old or young? I can't remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Long spiralling streams of silver, blue and grey silk descend from the supposed ceiling that is beyond your sight, the material resting in gentle piles amongst the cushions-- sorry, microphone-- against the cushions. Sitting within the center of the dome, no larger than a normal person, is an older woman of long, wavy silver hair. Her olive skin is somewhat weathered with wrinkles but the warmth of her smile and her vibrant purple eyes put you at ease. Her blue and white robes tumble out from her form in tendrils of parchment that snake through the pillows like roots of a giant tree. This is the Mistress, and she beckons you forward.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We step forward. Are we on the edge of the bowl? Is she in the bowl and we're on the edge of the bowl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You guys are on the edge of it. She's in the very center of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to go into the bowl?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we allowed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing seems to be holding you back.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: O Ioun, O goddess of knowledge, O lord who knows all. You know. But I don't. Let me ask you a question. And you'll see I didn't phrase that as a question because I know how gods work, and that probably would have been my question and then I might as well have just talked to a turnip. Which I've done. Found it pleasant. That being said, this is my question. The next thing out of my mouth is going to be my question. Why did you choose me to be your key? I'm nothing. I'm a coward. Why would you ever choose me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She opens her arms as you stand at the edge of this domed precipice, and you watch as the tendrils unfurl, pulling back a bit, revealing small pathways to walk down toward her. Her arms open in a welcoming motion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll walk forward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm walking in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Take a tumble.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The purpose in choosing you, Sprigg, was, as with all the other keys I've chosen before you, "an unlikely choice. You were at odds with many of my outlooks, but I saw within you, still, the seed "of the seeker of knowledge. So in that balance, I found a proper vessel. Someone who at once would "not be the choice that I would make to hide my key, but a person not beyond the realm of "redemption within the domain that I look over."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now, come. Please, sit. You've come a long way. I'm curious as to what your reasons are for "coming to me at this hour and I wish to see if my assumptions are correct. Sit."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't know already?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Well, the goddess of knowledge is implied in the title. Not insulting anyone. Knock knock.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who's there?"

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: You would know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as her stoic expression curls into a smile and her head falls back a bit to a small chuckle. (chuckles) "Humor is perhaps a bit thin in these walls as of late. It's nice to have a "laugh. Thank you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who was it, though?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: It was me the whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was Larkin, my friend."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She knows everything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Larkin!

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I don't know who that is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Many don't.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Well said.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There is one who has come from another plane to become a god himself, Vecna. For all we know, he may already have achieved godhood, but he's well on his path.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I know much about this individual you speak and I had assumed this was the reason for your arrival."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know if he's been successful?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do not. I've not sensed any change in the cosmetology of the world. Cosmology, even." Cosmetology.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I thought that was hair and makeup--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a different word. Her domains expand beyond just knowledge, guys. Hence the unfurling.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been thinking about getting some highlights for this beard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) Beauty school dropout.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But no. You see, this Vecna is in direct opposition to what I represent, and I believe has "taken some precautions to keep from my distant sight, so while I have assumptions and what "information makes its way to me, there is a bit of relying on you to fill in the gaps."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you wish to know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well. Do you intend to return to face this entity, or have you chosen or found champions in "Exandria who would rise up against this individual?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We didn't even realize that was an option.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hadn't occurred to us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow. Maybe that's very self-centered of us, now that I think about it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We intend to face him down ourselves.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We want to fight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're heading his direction no matter what.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you think you have the strength required to do this?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're gathering the strength right now. Some among us have already-- the one who's making weird faces has already sworn allegiance to another god.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hashtag blessed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The coming fight does indeed warrant the aid that "these journeys would muster and I can see the touch of my brethren on you already." And she motions towards Vax and Vex and Pike.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are not sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We fought once, and if this is a broom motion, we were just getting swooped. Swept. What is it? Swiffered.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pelor mentioned something about the Prime Trammels?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, if you are indeed here seeking my gift, know "that I do not grant it lightly. For those who are not already claimed--" She glances around the rest of the group. "Grog Strongjaw. Just being within my realm is of near-painful discomfort to you. For "that I apologize and can see you are not to be my vessel."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's okay, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. What a roller coaster. I was going up and then going back down. Thank you for your gaze, my lady.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog just invented amusement park rides.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Percival Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Rolo III--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispering) She knows everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hold the blade of the White Duke and walk a "parallel path. You are a storyteller, and I am the keeper of all stories. I shall task you with my "challenge."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not to question your infinite knowledge and judgment, but my stories are more of little bar room tales and silly poems to pass the time. I would hardly call them epic histories of civilization.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For now, perhaps."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: We're all stories in the end. Just make sure yours is a good one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you think that your compatriots would have the strength now to rise against such a "scourge had you not been there to lift their spirits with these tales?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's true, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm really powerful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And humble.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's my best asset.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And deeper than you let on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the cube.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughing) And a cube.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She glances over at you with a knowing look.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you have faith in me, I will have faith in you and trust you and your knowledge. And I will try to complete any task you ask of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then let the challenge be placed before you. Scanlan Shorthalt! Somewhere within this "library lies the book that contains the Incantation of Isolation, the arcane rite that "banished the Chained Oblivion. You have one hour to retrieve it. Your friends can help you, but you "can only present one tome to me. And should it be incorrect, then I shall await another warrior of "keen mind to find me and accept my gift, for I can only guide one strong enough to face the foe "before you. Return to me when you are certain you've found it. Your challenge begins now." And with that, her entire body vanishes in a gust of wind. All the little tendrils of paper flutter out and come to rest within the dome, and you look up and see the immensity of this library.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Incantation of Isolation?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Incantation of Isolation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I speak Primordial.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't know the name of the book, right? So we can't Locate Object.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a tome that contains the incantation of what?

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA, MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: Isolation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which was what they used--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is with this pencil? It was dipped in ketchup or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't use that pencil. Use one of your own.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it needs to be sharpened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just push really hard.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How do we do that? Sprigg!

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have a tome at your place that has the Incantation of Isolation?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Bye-bye.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you remember the name of it?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try casting Locate Object and cast it on the tome that contains the Incantation of Isolation. Try it. Why not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can it work like that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: An object known to you as long as you have seen it up close within 30 feet at least once.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Really?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. It's a spell I have now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction of the object's location, so as long as the object is within a thousand feet of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you cast the spell. And you think about it and you concentrate. Nothing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to kneel down and pray to the Dawnfather, since he was one of the ones that helped fight the Chained Oblivion, to see if he could guide us at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You close your eyes and focus and you begin to beseech the knowledge and wisdom of the Dawnfather. Two minutes pass with no answer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: During that two minutes, I'm going to scan the room. Is there any design or purpose to the layout of the room? Anything that stands out besides books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance around the room quickly, you see there are probably two dozen bookshelf aisle openings all around this central dome area. You begin to look around. You don't see any specific signs. Go ahead and roll a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Going to use my last Luck for this sleep cycle. Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about, you don't see any signs on the books. You do notice, however, there are hundreds of those somewhat spectral keepers of the library that are moving tomes through and organizing and relocating things, just like you saw when you first entered.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're spectral?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're spectral, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go try to talk to one of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. One of them's currently pulling books out. You can see the basic shimmering outline of a humanoid form, and they're taking a book off and stacking it and finding another.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello, sir. Do you have language? Can you speak?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He turns and looks to you for a second.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you help us find a book? It contains an Incantation of Isolation.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or about the Chained Oblivion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or about the Chained Oblivion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or about the Calamity or something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where are the lives of those who witnessed it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't seem to be at this moment--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No chance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to hop on my broom to see if I get a ping on my Locate Object.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. Before we start flying around, what do we know? When was this last used, this book? 886 years ago or whatever, right? 812 years ago.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, you know that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, it's 812 P-whatever. PD, right? So 812 years ago. So we're looking for a very old book that was used by Ioun? Who was it used by?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Potentially. Or the Dawnfather helped seal with Ioun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it's some sort of a wizard's or sorcerer's tome?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a question. Didn't one of us have a potion or scroll of language-speaking? Didn't we have that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do any of the tomes have titles on them, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about, and some of them do. They're all in Celestial.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to read off some titles.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Primordial.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None visibly currently in Primordial.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that the language they used before the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like Celestial would be what the Dawnfather would speak, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Celestial would be close. I would think more close than Primordial.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So make an investigation check. Who else is looking through books?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't speak Celestial, so it doesn't really matter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, make separate investigation checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're making investigation checks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anybody who's searching currently, or doing something that involves searching through books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys begin fanning out. And it's so overwhelming. It's so immense. There's thousands and thousands and tens of thousands of books within your immediate visual vicinity. And like I said, about 150 feet beyond you, it seems to fade into shadow and the more you walk towards that shadow, it reveals more books. They curve and spiral and almost seem to intertwine into that Escher painting-like advance towards the ceiling you don't see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it seem like some are older than others?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. They seem scattered. As you're going around you find some are Celestial. The further away from the center you get you do find some sections that are other languages. You see some that are in Abyssal. You don't find any that are Primordial yet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scattered amongst or categorized by language?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ones that are nearest to the center here are all names. They are all names of people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we need to find one that's not a name of a person.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Who used the Incantation of Isolation? Perhaps if we find the book of the user, we will find their spells.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was it Pelor? Does Pelor have a book?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they dead?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it continues writing, right? Potentially, there's a book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So there's a book that says Pelor on it? Or Ioun. Or Dawnfather.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or if Vecna is a dead man. Maybe a book with Vecna's name on it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know why the Incantation of Isolation would be--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, Percy, are these books arranged in any order? Chronological, name, anything? Oh, you didn't see anything when you looked?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're having a hard time really finding any pattern to the books.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fuck. There's no pattern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look at the bookbinding, though? Do some books seem like they fall apart more?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there's a wide variety of ages and types. The sense of the pattern of the sections of books: some of them seem to be clustered together and some of them seem to have similar colorations the further into the side. The further out you get from this the more scattered they get. It's almost like the organization begins from the center and either they're reorganized for reasons that are beyond your comprehension. You get the sense as you begin to hear this slight grinding-- you got the natural 20?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Earlier, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. So you've been glancing about and looking about. You pick up the slight sound (grinding). And you look up and you can see some of these shelves coming down from the ceiling that are stopping about 30 feet above you are sliding and moving. The actual library seems to have some sort of slow rearranging movement to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pop out the wings. Go up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are those called, Percy? The celestial, tell you the stars thing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, like some sort of astrolabe or something like that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Astrolabe? You know those big rotating things you can put in the year and the month in the calendar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, right. Nothing you've seen so far. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What am I looking for? Perception check? That's good. 17. 30 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around your current vicinity, you see nothing like that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are there any books in the bowl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a handful on one of the tables that are around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take a look at what's in the bowl.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I jump in and start throwing pillows around. Did she leave anything cool behind?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're throwing the pillows, some of them fling off to the side, and you uncover a couple of empty cups of tea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I drink them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You get some stale library-temperature tea. You do find a couple of large books on one of the nearby tables.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh! I found a large book on one of the nearby tables.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to read the names of these books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't ring a bell. And another one appears to be a book that pertains to the attempts of creating alchemical transitions from one base element to another. Essentially, what was the attempt at a philosopher's stone-like object long ago and the various trials and tribulations and unfortunate deaths that occurred because of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Interesting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I see anything different 100, 150 feet up? Does the change in perspective on the room below reveal anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are bookshelves that come up and stop and there are bookshelves that come down and stop, and you look up and you can see there are other spirits hanging upside down walking along the pathways above, as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, so it's like a mirror image, the top and bottom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's just a bottom and a top part of the library.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if that line is the demarcation between pre-Divergence and post-Divergence or something like that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's cool. Go up and in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here, get on the broom, Scanlan. We'll fly up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So Scanlan, you jump on her broom. (whooshing) You fly up. Who's taking a look? Make an investigation check if you do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hope that guides me in some way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a religion check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Religion check. Okay, well, that's terrible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Luck!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't have Luck. I can inspire myself. I will inspire myself with a little song. (singing) Scanlancito, he's got tiny feet-oh, but he likes to cast spells, he does it with his beat-oh. When you go to sleep-oh, better check your sheet-ohs, because after he eats-ohs, he likes to take a shit-oh! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god. Are you fucking kidding me? What the hell, man?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get that book.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, You earned that d12.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a 12. So that brings it up to 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Clutching the Ioun stone, as you sing this song, the stone glows ever so faintly in your hand and you glance up and you can see about ten of the various spectral librarians that are wandering have stopped and they're all looking at you. Seemingly temporarily distracted or entranced by the song.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go try to talk to one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Whoa!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You land next to all the librarians and as soon as you land, there's like a moment of quiet and they all go about their business again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On behalf of the Mistress Ioun, I speak in her name. And I'll hold up the stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's always good to lie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well she tasked me; it's not a lie! She tasked me with this. We seek a book. We would love some help, and it contains the Incantation of Isolation. Maybe about 812 years old-ish. Maybe 813?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No one seems to be paying attention to your words.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe sing it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have to sing it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pull out Mythcarver.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pull out Mythcarver and sing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay. I pull out a sword. (sword unsheathing)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just sing like it's a microphone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. (singing) Just take a look, it's in a book, the Scanlan rainbow. I can read anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the same librarians all of a sudden stop what they're doing and turn back towards you. The sword is vibrating and ringing; it's expanding the notes of your song, as is the nature of Mythcarver. You seem to have their attention.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now ask. Now sing and question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's been about 20 minutes, by the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh Jesus. I mean, Ioun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) I sing to you in desperation. I'm looking for a Tome of Isolation. We need to find a tome, so we can go home and kill a guy named Vecna. It would really make us... Nothing rhymes with Vecna.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a performance check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the librarians gather. They're up above you and they gather closely to you as you're singing this song and as you finish your final verse they all look a little confused, and they all begin to shift as one unit around the edge of one of the bookcases.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan! (yells) Scanlan!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (yells) What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have an earring.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, right. Sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a library; keep quiet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keep telling the story about the Calamity. Maybe if you talk about Vecna some more and what happened.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know my history.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a history check.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Tell him "heck, nah" rhymes with Vecna, if it helps at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vecna didn't have too much involvement in the Calamity directly. The Calamity mainly involved the gods battling. It involved the Chained Oblivion. It involved the sealing of that deity during one of the major battles of the Calamity. Those are elements of the history that pertain to the Calamity that you recall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're following the little surge of spectrals.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (rapping) What's his name, yo? (speaking) I got nothing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) He's the Chained Oblivion. His name is the Chained Oblivion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) And there's a million things he hasn't done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (singing) Because he's sealed.

lines.name: MATT, LAURA, TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: (singing) Because he's sealed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh fuck. Lin-Manuel just turned it off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Sorry. All right, so as you continue to sing, with each beat, each name that's mentioned that deals with the Calamity and the Chained Oblivion, you watch as their pace seems to quicken a bit, and then as the singing slows they begin to slow down again. There's a specific correlation and drive between your storytelling and your singing, and apparently the drive in which they're pushing towards their--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Keep telling the story.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Tell them the song about Vecna just might wreck ya. It's close; it doesn't work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, Sprigg, I got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear Sprigg yelling from down below, as he doesn't have an earring.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) If we don't act soon Vecna might just wreck ya. (speaking) I got it in there for you.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Thanks. Tell them about your neck, ma.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah. Wait, what?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: If you're discussing your neck to your mother, you would-- what? Oh, right. People get paid for that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) Oh my god.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Call back to earlier discussion. And nobody knows.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) God I hope I get it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) The book is eight centuries old, or so I'm told. It's fraught with mystery. It's teeming with history. So please listen to me and don't kiss me because I really need this book right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll another performance check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You continue forward for another ten minutes or so, so you've hit just over the 30-minute mark at this point, and you feel this little pulse from the stone. Do you continue to inspire?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a performance check with advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Didn't even need it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hashtag blessed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the speed is dangerous to the point where as trying to follow them you almost lose sight of them a couple of times. You being the driver of this, I need you to go ahead and make a perception check to make sure you can keep them in your vision.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Damn, Scanlan got bars, y'all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22. Okay. That's enough. You nearly lose them a few times and you're like (grunts). You have to take a second and listen out there and you see a faint glow of their spectral form in the distance. There! And so you continue to give chase. Then eventually, at about the 40-minute mark or so, you come to the outside. What's interesting, too, is a lot of these bookcases are made of different materials. Some of them are dark wood, light wood, some of them are metal and various substances. You come to, on the ceiling, jammed in, a bookcase, but it's made of a very dark slate gray metal. And it has chains across it and a series of locks on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) I had a feeling it would be a locked bookcase.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see them, all the librarians are clustered and circled around it right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can they open it up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. (singing) Can you open it up?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Find somebody that can pick them locks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no response from them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, they can pick books.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They can pick up books.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vax, can you hear me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. 500 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've been traveling for a while. He doesn't hear you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can try to pick it. I can try.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, multiclassing into that rogue now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you fumble around and quickly pull out your thieves' tools. All right, go ahead and roll a d20, add your dexterity modifier and your proficiency bonus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My proficiency bonus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to inspire her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) I'm so vain. I probably think this song is about me. I'm so vain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks for that. But I rolled well so it doesn't matter. Hopefully. 19 plus my dexterity modifier plus my proficiency bonus? 30.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She rolled a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The DC was 30.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was the inspiration!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, plus inspiration was 31!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the DC on that was 30.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, jeebies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There are DCs up to 30?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. 30's considered nearly impossible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're badasses now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What happens when you say that shit?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I'm just saying the difficulties are going to get harder.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, in god realm it will be harder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (clicking) It snaps your lockpick. As soon as you hear the (tink), your heart sinks, but you still have a little bit of leverage and you push forward on the broken pick, and it's just enough to get the tumbler to click in. Your lockpick is busted; you're going to have to get a new one. However, it does open on one side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's the hardest lock I've ever picked, I swear!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You open, and you can see about 25 different books of different shapes, sizes, colors, all ancient that are all in this small locked section.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are any of the spectrals looking at one, specifically?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they are all just at the side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you do your Ioun Stone?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, I'll blacklight it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it glow for anything in particular?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take your Ioun Stone, and as you go across, it doesn't seem to have an effect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to quickly scan the books to see if any of them look particularly old.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I read any of them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What languages do you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Elvish, Common, Undercommon, Abyssal, and Draconic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not much! Gnome, Marquesian, and Common.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is one book that has nothing on the spine; it's blank. About five of them appear to be in Abyssal. You, reading through them, a lot of them talk about-- they are history books that talk about the Lord of the Hells. There's one that speaks on rites and rituals of sacrifice. There is one that talks about the annihilation of a race that no longers exists in the world during the Age of Arcanum. There's one that talks about the birth of the Rune Children. There's all these books that all talk about different things, but nothing seems to stand out to you as the tome you might be looking for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I could potentially grab all of them and shove them in the Bag of Colding.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then what? How many minutes are left, and how far are we from our friends?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have about 15 minutes left and it's about ten minutes of travel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could take them all back and see if anyone can read.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It seems pretty shitty, dumping them out in a pile, but I don't know what else to do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. The spirits'll put them back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The one that has nothing on the binding. Can I open that and flip through real quick?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I start grabbing other ones and putting them in the bag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no words on the cover. You open it up and it's about four pages that are blank.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What can you do? Do you have a spell that lets you see things? Reveals things?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do not.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Talk to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Sing to it or something!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. I'll sing to a book, Matt. (singing) Read to me of times gone by. Can it be you're here when a bunch of gods died? (speaking) Okay. That's all I got.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Doesn't seem to respond to the singing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't tell anyone I sang to a book.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You just keep singing, I'll keep taking books. We've got not enough time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you about a minute to throw them all in there haphazardly.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: 25 books.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's get back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys dart back. You get low enough to the point where you're in between the two bookcaess. The heights vary and in some case you're having to suddenly shift up and over to avoid slamming into the side of the large bookcase. You're shooting through this-- almost like an up and down version of the Star Wars entry to the... Death Star. Thank you, my brain's not working.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My Locate Object never pinged? My Incantation of Isolation Locate Object?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Interestingly enough, thank you for reminding me of that. As soon as he pulled the book out, the one that he's holding, the one with no text on it, it pinged.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, I just grabbed a bunch of books, but that's the one!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's got to be! Keep looking at it while we're flying, see if you can figure it out!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold it upside down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hold onto me, though, because we're going fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to listen to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an arcana check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 13 plus five, 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. As you're darting by, you're clutching your side with your hand around her waist, reading it. You almost lose it a couple times.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus Jack of All Trades.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what's the total?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21. You get the sense that there is something magical about it. I would say, you can't put your finger on it, but what faint arcane essence that you can sense from your usage of spells, and the feeling of releasing spells, the charging and release of arcane energy. You get the sense of that release from the book. It's almost wanting something. It's pulling something very faintly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What spell? I don't want to hurt it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Place Mythcarver on it! Place Mythcarver in it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'll place Mythcarver on it. I don't know what to cast on a book!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll cast Friends on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was almost so bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cast Friends on it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you release the cantrip, the book seems to absorb the magic, but no reaction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, you barely hold on. I need you to roll a strength check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, can I hold onto his wrist to help out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not good. Strength?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be a strength saving throw, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten? The book's like (bouncing) and you catch it right as it falls and you hold it in your hand.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if you write in it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, what if you write in it and say, "Hey, I need the Incantation of Isolation!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Write in the book?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't you ever watch Harry Potter? He wrote in the book and it wrote back!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! I've never watched Harry Potter!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who are you?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you have a quill? Can you write it in? Can you write something in the book?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I must have a quill, right? I'm a storyteller.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd have to pull it out of your pouch, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'll pull out my quill.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And your inkwell?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus. While we're flying? This seems like a bad idea. This is a bad idea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you want to try it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! How about when we land?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you cast Friends on it? Did it work?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. It absorbed the spell and seemed to like it, but nothing happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What else can you do to imbue it with magic?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have the Ioun Stone, but it doesn't do anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're rushing, make another dexterity saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Jesus. Oh god. Okay. 27.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whoosh) You yank out of the way of another one that shifts. It's one that goes from ceiling to floor, it's one solid bookcase that comes right in the way. You manage to dart around the side. Make another strength saving throw to hold onto the book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, okay. The book you hold onto with one hand, and you pull it back--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I do Lightning, what if it burns the fucking book? I'll do Thunderwave on it, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thunderwave, the 1st-level spell?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you have Suggestion?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. I'll Dominate Monster, that's a super high-level spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What level spell is that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 8th-level spell, Dominate Monster on the book? Okay! As you're flying through, you cast the spell into the book and the book takes the entirety of the spell into it, and you watch as suddenly text emboldens across all the pages on the inside. The book is now filled with scribblings and writing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What language is it?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know, what language is it?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yelling)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a notebook! It's somebody who was figuring this out as they were writing it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance over your shoulder, and it's empty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you sure something's there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I have a beautiful mind! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you arc down into the center of the library where you see the large dome where you first met Ioun. You're not sure how much time you have left, but it's down to the wire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I see any words that say isolation or incantation or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a small book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I like to read things and really understand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The script on the cover seems, in a weird way, the best I could say is a Google Translate version, but it loosely translates to the Tome of Isolation, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's the whole thing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a cookbook.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She just asked for the tome, right? You got it.

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Alone: I am Tome.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She disappeared. Where is she?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's going to reappear, obviously. She knows we're here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go down to her bowl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we're at the bowl.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so let's go down into the bowl and wait for her to arrive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys land in the center there. What's everybody else doing right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I barrel rolled out of the way as they rushed by.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was sitting on the couch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've been digging through the pillows.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Looking for change in the couch?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Did you know that "Heck, nah" could rhyme with Vecna? Did you hear what I said?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I heard when you yelled it. It was the "Neck, Ma," that I couldn't come up with a way--

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: If you're speaking to your mother, let's say, and pointing at your neck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're such a pain in the neck, Ma!

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Exactly! Pain in the neck, Ma! Looking for Vecna, he's a pain in the neck, Ma! Find him? I say heck nah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wish you would have been chosen by Ioun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, resting her arms crossed in front of her robes. She looks out. "Are you to present your findings?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I casually blow the hair out of my face and walk over to her and say, O mighty goddess, it was a challenging challenge, but I think you'll be pretty happy with the results. As I hold up the book, I'll cast Wrist Pocket and make it disappear. Oh god, oh it's gone! Just kidding. And it's back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She doesn't flinch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is what we've found for you. I hope it pleases you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And this is your final choice?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, we didn't actually look at the other ten books.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Regis Philbin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is that your final answer?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. With conviction, I firmly believe that this is the correct book.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It has been a while since I thumbed through these "pages myself. This will do you well in the coming fray." And she hands it out to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I still see the writing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll cherish it always.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And for that, I grant my grace unto you for the coming fray, Scanlan Shorthalt." And it's a little off-putting at first, but in her forehead, where you saw her two purple eyes, a third eye opens up in the center of the forehead. It seems to glow for a second. You watch as on Scanlan, this warmth fills your body; you stand up straight instinctually. You guys watch as this strange purple glow appears in the center of his forehead in the same place where her eye was.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh, you have a third eye!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it cool or is it gross?

lines.name: TRAVIS, LIAM
lines.text: It's cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Chicks will dig?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep! Third nip, third eye. You're good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gently fades away. The warmth vanishes and you're restored to yourself. That given the case, you have the Tome of Isolation and the Blessing of the Knowing Mistress.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You chose wisely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I gain plus two to my intelligence! Whoa!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All the timesies?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As a bonus action, I can channel the omniscience of Ioun. For one hour, whenever you successfully hit a creature with a spell or attack, you can learn one of the creature's stats of your choice from the following list: AC, senses, saving throw bonuses, damage resistances, damage immunities, damage vulnerabilities. During this hour, you also have advantage on initiative rolls and on saving throws. Once this ability is used, it cannot be used again for a week. Okay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many things can you learn about?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can learn what its vulnerabilities are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's like a game mod for a character.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's the gold thing that came with the original Nintendo Entertainment System. The Game Genie.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I certainly remembered my Charlemagne! Let my armies be the--

lines.name: LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: -- rocks and the trees and birds in the sky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On a success, the text becomes blurred until the end of your next turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: On a success?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On a success. On a failure of their saving throw. Right, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If they succeed on their saving throw, they resist the ability and you cannot read the book for another turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it. Then, after that turn, I can read it again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it say the DC is?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: DC ten. A wisdom saving throw-- oh! That's key info. Plus five to DC for each Divine Trammel fused to the target. We've got to be matadors and attach a bunch of pegs to the thing before we deliver the killing blow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We literally stick the trammels onto Vecna?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll be picadors, right? They put the darts on the back of the bull to soften it up and (whoosh) killing blow!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And do we have any of these yet?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have one! No, I have a stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a stone that supposedly has something to do with their construction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we were supposed to ask Ioun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I think we're done here, guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll just go to Home Depot and get some trammels.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I pull out the little pearl of power?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You pull it out and there it glows before you. It's bright like a tiny star for a second and you have to avert your gaze. But there it is, still warm to the touch. The small pearl of bright, divine light. "With this blessing, I hope to be of some aid in the coming "battle. Also, any questions you may have, I'm here to answer."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, so many!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we make a trammel? We have a stone, and we want more, I assume.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now, the original trammels that we had utilized were forged by the hand of the Allhammer atop the "fiery Core Anvil deep beneath the Ozmit Sea."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, the core?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Core Anvil."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the Ozmit Sea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now, the Core Anvil, this was part of the domain of the Allhammer's greatest creations. It was "where the first dwarves were given form and breath, it's where the trammels were carved and "made in the last great war. It lies beneath the undersea volcano now known as Scaldseat."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scaldseat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The vision fades from you. She leans to you and says, "Find a way below, through the tunnels of "toxic fume, unbreathable without proper preparation, to the Core Anvil and forge these "trammels. Be warned: There may be protections that still remain within the forgotten halls of the "Allhammer, or new denizens that occupy the subterranean depths. Now, to forge such a trammel, "however, is an undertaking no mortal has attempted. To shape the materials would require "the strength of a titan." She looks towards you and the eye flashes and suddenly your mind fills with hundreds of years of the knowledge of folding heated metals, of the clinks of lives past, shaping and building weapons and armor and for a second you pull back and you can see the large dwarf-like stone form of the Allhammer, slamming down onto the heated metals of the Core Anvil. As the vision fades, you know how to forge, so you are now proficient with blacksmithing tools.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Proficient with blacksmithing tools?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Awesome! Oh my god, you were a boot maker, and now you're a weapon maker!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Suddenly, you understand most of the tools in Percy's workshop.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait a minute!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But not just the strength of a titan. For to understand the intricacies of this design will "also require the ingenuity of a madman." She turns towards you, Percy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's you!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Trying to look away, kid at the back of the classroom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy takes one step behind Keyleth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like the kid that farts in class and then looks at the guy behind him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see the purple glow in the center of Percival's forehead for a moment. In an instant, the intricate designs of the Prime Trammel flood into your mind, the celestial instructions racing through like a shock of electricity, the blueprints spinning like a clear dream, straight out of Flight of the Navigator, all of the star charts being crammed at once. With that, it drops from your mind and you fall to your knees with a pounding headache.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not supposed to know that. (groans)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For me, our greatest purpose has passed the moment we granted your forbearers the spark to "seek their own purpose. We now stay to inspire, to guide, to guard the Gate, to keep the hate of "ignorance we spawned in our hubris from burning away everything. The rest is up to you. We need "you, perhaps, but you do not need us. That is our gift. You, Fate-Touched, you are the embodiment of "this truth. All mortal life has potential with or without the gods. We offer some paths, but it's up "to you to decide if they are the right ones for you. Anyway." And she clutches her stomach a moment. "What more do you ask of me? What more do you wish to know?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have questions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, ask."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vecna. You're familiar. You know not where he is. You know of him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is all I have to offer on the history of Vecna and I hope it can be of aid to you in your "coming battle."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What was the name of the sword?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The Sword of Kas."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Sword of Kas. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did it have a name?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where was it last seen?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In Thar Amphala, at the scene of the battle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh! Okay. The Sword of Kas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't think?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think. What are the odds, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It was 800 years ago.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: Different sword.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not Craven Edge?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have another question for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know who I serve.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do. I see the shadows that cling to you."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vecna seeks godhood, and we understand that my lady achieved the same. Did you learn anything from her path that would help us here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Our timetable accelerates." You can see now, her eyes begin to race back and forth. "It will take "him some time to understand and utilize his nature fully. If he expands beyond his avatar, it will be "more difficult to seal him. The more trammels it may require and the loss maybe far greater."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have a seed of power?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Take this fragment of my own story and help craft the passages of the world's future." She reaches into the center of her robe, and almost seems to be into her chest and plucks forth a small, gray gem about the size of a peanut. It glows faintly, and as she removes it, you hear a terrible creaking sound throughout the library. You watch as books plummet from the darkness above and slam into the ground around you. Distant cases crack and bow. The roar of the damaged space echoes to a halt, the danger seemingly in control. "There. I can spare no more. I must rest and concentrate."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I have something of you inside of me. Would it help you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She smiles. "I could use a steward for a moment. Someone eager to learn and relearn some "important lessons. Ethred Brokenbranch."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: That's me!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would you be so kind as to help an old woman tend to her books a bit?"

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: It would be my pleasure. I didn't believe in you. I didn't think you were real, but I found out that things aren't what we seem. And things can change. It would be my honor. (stammers) Could I say goodbye?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Also, do you know where there's an imp by the name of Demistrik and if he's all right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's fine for now."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I'm not asking for me. The nice lady with the antlers wanted to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's fine, but woe to those who live in the home in Kraghammer where he's currently rooted."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: He's a very bad performer. I'll be right with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Well, then. This is different! I don't think I'm going to be alone anymore. I asked you for power, but it seems like you gave me strength.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. I'm glad to hear that.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: No one ever did that before. (growl)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (tongue click) I kiss him on the forehead.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Well! Oh dear me. Oh goodness gracious. Be happy. Life is loud and noisy, and it's a celebration. I didn't know that. So once in a while, with what little time we have, be happy. I was wrong about you, you know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: If only I could be a mirror of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, Sprigg, for everything. We've only known you a short time--

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I'm only a short person. (laughs) You can have that one for free. Okay, good. Go on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, you've taught us much in a short time, and I'm sorry that we broke your house, but it seems like you've found a suitable replacement.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Celebrate it with your friends. Remember that. And when I look at these books, I'm going to think of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That pleases me.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Oh, good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Be happy here.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: I was just a sprig. That's how I got my name.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If only people knew that sprigs give foundation to the entire tree.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She extends her hand to you.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Well, this is new.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And should your friends succeed, there is far much more to look forward to learning."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Excellent. But some of those little wispy things, I don't trust them, you know. If they get out of order, we should wispy thing grab. How will we remember that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is going to be a very good conversation to have."

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: We need a mnemonic device. Come! We'll think of one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. We shall. As for the rest of you, I feel my power is waned, and I don't have "the means of sending you away myself. But if you are able to return under your own power?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispers) Of course.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And please, don't be a stranger."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! I have your books.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yes. 24 of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think they were really secret ones, so I would hate to take those out of here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as three spectral servants apparate behind you and pick up the books and begin to take them back to be organized. "Not to worry. Travel safe, my friends. And Scanlan, don't "ever forget how important you are to them, to Kaylie, and to yourself. You owe yourself far more "that you lend."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will remember.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Goodbye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bye, Sprigg.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Take care, darling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bye, Sprigg.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Until next time.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: That's good. Off we go, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Come, my friend." She takes his hand and stands up, and they both begin to walk away and as it does there's a slight increase of light in the room. There's a flash, and then as it slowly comes back to a normal sight, you find yourself back at the entrance almost bathhouse-like area of the domain where you arrived, the marble slightly more cracked that you left it before, but still standing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Enjoy the other side, Sprigg.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go up to Percy. Are you all right, dear?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Strangely, yes. Yes, quite. Didn't think I would be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vax. Is that what's going to happen when you leave?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispers) I don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Shall we?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where are we going?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Back to where we came from.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the beginning? Or more recently?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Back to the cabin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The cabin?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The little house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean Sprigg's cabin? Why would we go there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's been sitting there for probably about an hour or two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh yeah, the guy that you put in the shackles.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sure he's fine. Let's just go to Whitestone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But we want to get the shackles back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's the shackles.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I want to talk to him, too, but yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going for the shackles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're pretty cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They are pretty impressive.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But she said the timetable is shortened.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why are we going to Whitestone, then?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have to find this place in the middle of the ocean.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, now that we know where it is, you can probably bamf us there, can't you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I need to go Whitestone or to Vasselheim.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before we go to Issylra? Wait. Is Vasselheim on Issylra? How close did I recognize the shore--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shorecomb? Shorecomb is about 200, 250 miles away from Vasselheim, to the southwest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Southwest, going towards Pyrah. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beyond Pyrah, along the coast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Start there. I should be able to Tree Stride us right there. Right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From the cabin to Vasselheim?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None of the particular trees you got a close look at. You may have to scry to get a specific tree in mind for the spell, but you can do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike, you seem very quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a lot going on."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know when I feel overwhelmed I like to punch things. You want to hit me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay." (punching noise) And she socks you in the gut.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (groans) Too strong. Oh, such a monster.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sorry." And she Cures Wounds on you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I burn my 8th-level spell to Plane Shift us back to Sprigg's house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you all gather hands together, with the familiar flash and a pull through the Divine Gate, you all find yourselves thrust once more back to the Prime Material Plane. As your feet land squarely in the partially charred, wooded remains of Sprigg's house, deep in a ravine in the Cliffkeep Mountains of Tal'Dorei in Exandria. And that's where we're going to take a break.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fudge knuckles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Darin. Thank you so much for joining us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Darin De Paul! (applause)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dude. Thank you for coming.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: It had to happen. It's history. It's a journey.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 35 years?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's crazy. I love it.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Yeah, in another 37 years! We'll do this again!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Hopefully sooner, but yeah.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: Thank you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was a pleasure. We know you just came on this show so you could get onto Talks. But we'll take it anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you could have just asked if you wanted to meet Brian Foster.

lines.name: DARIN
lines.text: His hair is so cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's got a good beard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was the word we chose?

lines.name: OFFSCREEN
lines.text: Knowledge.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you. Knowledge. The word in the chat room is knowledge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought you said college.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're super excited. It's written by good friend of the show Matt Colville. If you're not familiar with his stuff, you should. He's written a couple of books, he's written a lot of video game stuff and he's very talented.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The dialogue is to

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He is on this week's episode of GM Tips.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can check him out, right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll have more information in the future about it as it comes out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've seen most of the art for issue one and it is fucking legit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I haven't seen it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I may, Matt? Music level, split the difference.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And to EmeraldStar in the chat, who named their puppy Grog, that's awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: FluffyArsonist, congratulations, Danoba will contact you to get your information and get that shipped out to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hard to be mad at an arsonist when they're fluffy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys were returning to Whitestone? Where were you going?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sprigg's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, Sprigg's cabin, correct. As the surge of momentum comes to a halt and your feet once again touch the ground here within the somewhat-charred remains of Sprigg's cabin, you look about. The crickets have taken the surrounding forest. Night has fallen since your exit. What would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there any threatening creatures in the vicinity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I look, too, because we'd been fighting when we left, so I'm going to make sure--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't worry, it's a 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance about very quickly at the surrounding woods and trees, and aside from a squirrel that scatters upon the sound of your footfalls--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Careful of traps. They're still in place.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, the squirrel goes (running noise, explosion).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bear trap.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Slams two feet above it, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to go into the room and find the nice creature that we left there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you walk amongst the rubble, you see there, trapped within the iron cage-like manacles and bindings of the small iron ball, you see the slathering tongue of the undead entity that you had entrapped. (slobbering noises)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I don't suppose we need you any more, do we? I'm going to take out my sword and very slowly end that.

lines.name: MATT
